description.narrative:
All the local actors of the two villages were involved in the phase of needs analysis and the conception of the project proposal, this with a dual purpose, on the one hand to guarantee the full involvement and satisfaction of the community fabric in the initiative, on the other to get as complete a picture as possible of the situation in the two villages. The interaction with local actors, facilitated by RWDS which knows the two villages very well, took place through individual and collective meetings, in order both to strengthen the direct relationship of the project consortium with the various actors, and to promote an community as possible with exchanges of ideas and discussions between the various actors. As indicated above (point 7) the beneficiaries of the project were selected through a participatory approach. The approach, used during the assessment phases, also involved the families of the beneficiaries in order to mitigate as much as possible the risks of threats to the project by the men of the families. In addition, the projectconsortium also involved the Palestinian administrative levels (Ministry of Agriculture) in the definition of the project proposal,this in order to legitimize the proposal and to collect opinions, suggestions and guarantee institutional support.
The beneficiaries of the project will have a role of protagonists, in fact they will be involved, especially thanks to the animators of RWDS, in directing and evaluating the activities aimed at them and in the management, production and commercial direction of the cooperatives of which they are founding members. . The weekly visits and related reports will be monitoring tools and will be used by the partnership to evaluate the progress of the activities and identify possible improvements. An extract of them will be discussed during the coordination meetings between partners. In the same way, the relevant local actors will be involved in meetings and meetings in orderto receive their feedback, for a strong involvement and support of the two communities. Furthermore, considering the local sensitivity, the involvement of the families of the cooperatives (husbands, fathers, children) was envisaged during the establishment of thecooperatives so that the participation of women is accepted and recognized by the whole family. Finally Oxfam applies a feedback methodology based on Oxfam's minimum standards on MEAL Common Approach to Monitoring and Social Accountability, which provides for theactivation of feedback mechanisms open to the whole community and to the beneficiaries to collect reports and comments, which will be periodically analyzed. and will allow to improve the effectiveness of the project.

participating-org.narrative:
Rural Women#s Development Society (RWDS) is a Palestinian non-governmental organization working in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip. Founded in 1987 as the women#s group in Palestinian Agricultural Relief Committees (PARC), RWDS is now independentlyregistered with the Palestinian Authority under RA-287-C.
RWDS has a strong and respected grassroots presence in rural communities and 3000+women members in a network of 60 women#s clubs. Our unique structure, geographic breadth and large core of dedicated, grassroots volunteers distinguish RWDS from other Palestinian women#s organizations.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
